comments: I loved Eli and the way the class was set up. You can skip any of the 4 total exams which the points are later bypassed to final. Homework is all on WebAssign; clicker questions in class count as a quiz grade although, it is a great way to earn extra credit (only EC in the class). Visit his office if you need any help!! Skipped 3 exams, made a C+!!

comments: Overall, he is a great professor. He will keep you laughing in class while you learn and offers a lot of extra credit through his clicker points. The exams he gives matches the practice exams that he provides online, so it is easy to study for tests.

comments: Dr. Hvastkovs made Chemistry bearable. He rambles a lot about random stuff in class, but he at least always tried to make lecture fun. He gave good examples in class when explaining material, and his practice tests are almost identical to the actual exams. He also gives extra credit for the clicker questions we answered in class.

comments: He is a great professor. Going in I didn\'t know anything about chem and learned a lot. Attendance is not mandatory but you do clicker questions which if you do all of them give you a lot of extra credit. There is a lot of extra credit that bumped me up from a B+ to an A. He is willing to work with you and make ok joke.

comments: 4 tests u can choose to skip all but the exam will be worth more. 25 pts for taking all 4. Clicker quizzes everyday but if you come everyday, you have more than enough pts, so you can afford to miss classes. Tests are pretty much the clicker quizzes + frq. Free online textbook. Go to his review sessions if you are having trouble, they\'re helpful.

comments: Eli is a great and laid back teacher perfect for your first Chemistry class of college. He is super attractive, funny, and relatable. The homework assignments due every week are hard, but if you have a study group they are bearable. The tests aren\'t too difficult, and he gives study guides that help a lot.

comments: By far the best teacher I\'ve ever had. He makes the material easy to understand and makes the lectures fun to listen to. Try to sit up front and ask lots of questions in class. This class requires that you study hard and complete all of the homework, but as long as you prepare for the tests you\'ll get a good grade.

Explains things easier during office hours. Likes blonde roast coffee with half&half @ Starbucks!
